title: Usage guidance
text: package assumes hierarchical testing procedure three-arm gold-standard non-inferiority design applied. first test aims establish assay sensitivity trial. test superiority experimental treatment (T) placebo treatment (P). assay sensitivity successfully established, treatment tested non-inferiority control treatment (C). Individual observations assumed normally distributed, higher values correspond better treatment effects. Testing assumed done via Z test statistics. highly recommend reading open-access article (Meis et al., 2022) theoretical background package explained.

title: Usage guidance
text: (approximately) first line Table 2 paper:
code: tab1_D1 <- optimize_design_onestage(   alpha = .025,   beta = .2,   alternative_TP = .4,   alternative_TC = 0,   Delta = .2,   print_progress = FALSE ) tab1_D1 #> Sample sizes (stage 1): T: 413, P: 125, C: 404 #> Efficacy boundaries (stage 1): Z_TP_e: 1.95996, Z_TC_e: 1.95996 #> Maximum overall sample size: 942 #> Placebo penalty at optimum (kappa * nP): 0.0 #> Objective function value: 942.0 #> Type I error for TP testing: 2.5% #> Type I error for TC testing: 2.5% #> Power: 80.2%

title: Usage guidance
text: (approximately) second line Table 2 paper:
code: optimize_design_twostage(   cP1 = tab1_D1$stagec[[1]]$P, # The allocation ratios are enforced to be   cC1 = tab1_D1$stagec[[1]]$C, # the same as in the optimal single-stage design.   cT2 = 1,             cP2 = tab1_D1$stagec[[1]]$P,    cC2 = tab1_D1$stagec[[1]]$C,       bTP1f = -Inf,     # These two boundary conditions enforce no futility stops.   bTC1f = -Inf,      beta = 0.2,   alternative_TP = 0.4,   alternative_TC = 0,   Delta = 0.2,   print_progress = FALSE ) #> Sample sizes (stage 1): T: 224, P: 68, C: 219 #> Sample sizes (stage 2): T: 224, P: 68, C: 219 #> Efficacy boundaries (stage 1): Z_TP_e: 2.10510, Z_TC_e: 2.27093 #> Futility boundaries (stage 1): Z_TP_f: -Inf, Z_TC_f: -Inf #> Efficacy boundaries (stage 2): Z_TP_e: 2.27188, Z_TC_e: 2.10568 #> Inverse normal combination test weights (TP): w1: 0.70711, w2: 0.70711 #> Inverse normal combination test weights (TC): w1: 0.70711, w2: 0.70711 #> Maximum overall sample size: 1022 #> Expected sample size (H1): 801.2 #> Expected sample size (H0): 1020.3 #> Expected placebo group sample size (H1): 82.8 #> Expected placebo group sample size (H0): 134.8 #> Objective function value: 801.2 #> (local) type I error for TP testing: 2.50% #> (local) type I error for TC testing: 2.50% #> Probability of futility stop (H1): 0.00% #> Probability of futility stop (H0): 0.00% #> Minimum conditional power: 0.00% #> Power: 80.20% #> Futility boundaries: nonbinding #> Futility testing method: always both futility tests

text: cP1 (numeric) allocation ratio nP1 / nT1. Parameter optimized left unspecified. cC1 (numeric) allocation ratio nC1 / nT1. Parameter optimized left unspecified. alpha type error rate. beta type II error rate. alternative_TP assumed difference T P H1. Positive values favor T. alternative_TC assumed difference T C H1. Positive values favor T. Delta non-inferiority margin test \(X_T - X_C \leq - \Delta\) vs. \(X_T - X_C > - \Delta\). varT variance treatment group. varP variance placebo group. varC variance control group. round_n (logical) TRUE, design integer valued sample sizes returned. kappa (numeric) penalty factor placebo patients default objective function. objective (expression) objective criterion. inner_tol_objective (numeric) used determine tolerances integrals nuisance optimization problems inside objective function. mvnorm_algorithm algorithm multivariate integration passed pmvnorm. nloptr_x0 (numeric vector) starting point optimization. nloptr_lb (numeric vector) lower bound box box constrained optimization. nloptr_ub (numeric vector) upper bound box box constrained optimization. nloptr_opts (list) nloptr options. See nloptr. print_progress (logical) controls whether optimization progress visualized calculation. ... additional arguments passed along.

title: Calculate optimal design parameters for a single-stage gold-standard design — optimize_design_onestage
text: Design object (list) optimized design parameters.

title: Calculate optimal design parameters for a single-stage gold-standard design — optimize_design_onestage
text: function calculates optimal design parameters two-stage three-arm gold-standard non-inferiority trial. Run vignette("Introduction", package = "OptimalGoldstandardDesigns") see examples related associated paper (Meis et al., 2023). Parameters can optimized allocation ratios groups stages futility efficacy boundaries first stage. allocation ratios cT2 = nT2 / nT1, cP1 = nP1 / nT1, cP2 = nP2 / nT1, cC1 = nC1 / nT1 cC2 = nC2 / nT1. , nT1 denotes sample size treatment group first stage, nP2 sample size placebo group second stage, etc. first stage efficacy boundaries bTP1e treatment vs placebo testing problem, bTC1e treatment vs control non-inferiority testing problem. futility boundaries denoted bTP1f bTC1f. parameters left unspecified set NULL, included optimization process, otherwise considered boundary constraints. may also supply quoted expressions arguments parameters solve constrained optimization problem. example, can supply cT2 = 1, cP2 = quote(cP1), cC2 = quote(cC1) ensure first second stage allocation ratios equal. design optimized respect objective criterion given parameter objective. default, overall sample size plus optional penalty placebo group sample size, controlled parameter kappa. Designs calculated fulfill following constraints: family-wise type error rate controlled alpha combination two null hypotheses muT - muP = 0 muT - muC + Delta = 0. power reject hypothesis given alternative hypotheses muT - muP = alternative_TP muT - muC + Delta = alternative_TC + Delta least 1 - beta. Variances assumed given varT, varP varC. binding_futility TRUE, type error recycling used. always_both_futility_tests TRUE, assumed futility tests hypotheses performed interim, regardless whether treatment vs placebo null hypothesis successfully rejected. always_both_futility_tests FALSE, futility test treatment vs. control testing problem needs done null treatment vs. placebo testing problem rejected first stage.

title: Calculate optimal design parameters for a two-stage gold-standard design — optimize_design_twostage
text: function calculates optimal design parameters two-stage three-arm gold-standard non-inferiority trial. Run vignette("Introduction", package = "OptimalGoldstandardDesigns") see examples related associated paper (Meis et al., 2023). Parameters can optimized allocation ratios groups stages futility efficacy boundaries first stage. allocation ratios cT2 = nT2 / nT1, cP1 = nP1 / nT1, cP2 = nP2 / nT1, cC1 = nC1 / nT1 cC2 = nC2 / nT1. , nT1 denotes sample size treatment group first stage, nP2 sample size placebo group second stage, etc. first stage efficacy boundaries bTP1e treatment vs placebo testing problem, bTC1e treatment vs control non-inferiority testing problem. futility boundaries denoted bTP1f bTC1f. parameters left unspecified set NULL, included optimization process, otherwise considered boundary constraints. may also supply quoted expressions arguments parameters solve constrained optimization problem. example, can supply cT2 = 1, cP2 = quote(cP1), cC2 = quote(cC1) ensure first second stage allocation ratios equal. design optimized respect objective criterion given parameter objective. default objective function described Subsection Optimizing group sequential gold-standard designs Section 2 associated paper. Additionally, objective includes term penalize maximum sample size trial, can controlled parameter nu (default nu=0). Designs calculated fulfill following constraints: family-wise type error rate controlled alpha combination two null hypotheses muT - muP = 0 muT - muC + Delta = 0. power reject hypothesis given alternative hypotheses muT - muP = alternative_TP muT - muC + Delta = alternative_TC + Delta least 1 - beta. Variances assumed given varT, varP varC. binding_futility TRUE, type error recycling used. always_both_futility_tests TRUE, assumed futility tests hypotheses performed interim, regardless whether treatment vs placebo null hypothesis successfully rejected. always_both_futility_tests FALSE, futility test treatment vs. control testing problem needs done null treatment vs. placebo testing problem rejected first stage.
